questions.questionText: Which of the following does TypeScript use to specify types?
questions.explanation: TS uses a colon (:) to separate the property name from the property type

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a type used in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: enum is not used as a type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: How can we specify properties and methods for an object in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: interfaces are typically used to list the properties and methods for an object

questions.questionText: How else can Array<number> be written in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: number[] is another way of writing Array<number> in TypeScript

questions.questionText: In which of these does a class take parameters?
questions.explanation: a constructor is used by a class to take in parameters

questions.questionText: Which is NOT an access modifier?
questions.explanation: async is not used as an access modifier type in TypeScript

questions.questionText: Which keyword allows us to share information between files in TypeScript?
questions.explanation: the export keyword allows for the information to be transmitted between files

questions.questionText: Which is an array method to generate a new array based on a condition?
questions.explanation: filter is a method used to conditionally create a new array

questions.questionText: How is a property accessible within a class?
questions.explanation: this.propertyName is the way to access a specific property within a class

questions.questionText: What does AoT compilation stand for in Angular?
questions.explanation: This is The full form of the AOT

questions.questionText: Which module is used for HTTP requests in Angular?
questions.explanation: This is current module of HTTPmodule

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of Angular services?

options.text: To create animations in Angular applications
To define the structure of the data
To handle business logic and share data and functions across components

questions.explanation: javascript is not same as java bothe are difference
